descriptionSet.description: Amitabh Bachchan and Smita Patil laugh while hugging in the rain.

inscription.text: Chaudhry Enterprises' Namak Halaal Cinemascope eastmancolor
directed by Prakash Mehra produced by Satyendra Pal music Bappi Lahiri

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: Chaudhry Enterprises' Namak Halaal Cinemascope eastmancolor
text-en: directed by Prakash Mehra produced by Satyendra Pal music Bappi Lahiri
description-en: Amitabh Bachchan and Smita Patil laugh while hugging in the rain. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Namak Halaal (The Loyal One, Prakash Mehra, 1982) was a star vehicle production for Amitabh Bachchan, presenting him with the opportunity to display his skills. Like the poster publicity of most major films, Namak Halaal also sought to showcase its elaborate ensemble form – a concoction of comedy, drama, action and romance. (Ranjani Mazumdar) (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: We see Bachchan and Smita Patil captured in a “moment” that directly references their dance in the rain to the films hit song “Aaj rapat jaye to hume na dikhayyo.” The same poster’s literal rendition makes it different from the more abstract forms of the other Bachchan posters. One could easily refer to this as a “sequence poster” which wants to highlight the music of the film. Namak Halaal’s release takes place in the midst of the explosion in the consumer electronic industry. The cassette boom which started around 1980, expanded rapidly with the rising sale of cassettes in the next few years. (Ranjani Mazumdar) (gs)
